result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfredo Alarcon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alfredo Alarcon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alfredo Alarcon was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Straight.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay all court costs.
Pay extradition costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges become due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample.

- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- No possession of or use of illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Random urine screens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alfredo Alarcon in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   As to Count 2:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed.  Court suspends defendant's voting rights until they are restored.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections, straight,  with 21 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.
  Conditions of Probation:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of or use of illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
- no possession of firearms

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay all court costs.
Pay extradition costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges become due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.

Court allow for probation to be served in the State of Illinois.

Filed:  
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
